properties.detail: Cuyahoga Valley National Park requested a commercial services analysis and strategy to aid the park in examining how commercial services could diversify recreation opportunities and make better use of the existing facilities to serve the visiting public. Consultants will suggest potential program improvements as well as recommendations for expansion and new services.

Fire Island National Seashore requested BPI assistance in developing a strategic approach to managing its leasing program. The project will design formal processes and establish appropriate capacity to allow for potential expansion of the program to include several other high-potential locations.

Harpers Ferry Center is currently defining a new mid-term strategic vision and requested BPI support to provide an innovative organizational design that will standardize project intake, prioritization, and management. The project will help simplify project management processes, remove barriers to collaboration, support efficient project planning and budgeting at the park level, and help project managers balance workloads.

properties.type: Special Use Permit Improvement & Land Lease Evaluation
properties.detail: Appalachian National Scenic Trail requested a Special Use Permit strategy to guide the park's special use permit program, which includes special event, agricultural, construction, and right-of-way permits. The project will help to streamline the permit inquiry process, better filter and prioritize requests, and share information and policies amongst its partners.

Buffalo National Scenic River has requested BPI assistance with developing a comprehensive facilities investment strategy. The evaluation will include analysis of facility utilization by the park and its visitors, current condition, projected facility needs, resource impacts, and recommendations for overall investment strategies over the next 10 years.

Julia and Nick determined the employee demand for park housing units and recommended additional residential and non-residential park facilities for conversion into housing, with the goal of alleviating recruitment and retention challenges by providing access to more housing.

Daniel and Joseph kicked off a workforce and budget planning process, which included holding multiple facilitated sessions with state and nonprofit partners, analyzing gaps and strategic tensions, codifying a position management strategy, and developing tools for the park to use to weigh strategies that would reduce the parkï¿½s personnel costs as a percent of their total base budget.

Sarah and Stefan built a formal project management organization and process for facilities project implementation based on past funding and workload trends, extensive in-park interviews, and the creation of best practice case studies from across the NPS.
